title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview. Manager made the interview fun and relaxing.   I stayed with the company for three years until I relocated down south. Atmosphere was nice  to work in.   Questions were the basic “tell me a time when”
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you had a difficult patient

title: System Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Health Services
Interview Descriptions: I recently had an outstanding interview experience with a company, and I wanted to share my positive experience on Glassdoor. From the moment I walked into the interview room, I could sense a welcoming and friendly atmosphere. The interviewers were genuinely interested in getting to know me and assessing my fit for the role, making the entire experience enjoyable and engaging.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why choose this firm

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Health Services
Interview Descriptions: you will have two interviews one by phone the other zoom video. both went well no difficult questions. they will do you know how to work from two differnet monitors which is simple.
Interview Questions: can you set up your own equippmet

title: Insurance Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Health Services (Saint Pete, FL) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough in explaining job role and expectations. I was given an office tour and employees were extremely welcoming and helpful. Was definitely the most comfortable interview I’ve ever had. Definitely worth your time if you’re interested in a sales position
Interview Questions: Are you prepared to work hard?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard questions, they called first then an in person interview and then a second interview with the manager on the floor. From there they sent an offer letter to sign via email.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses How to deal with aggressive patients

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone call and then a virtual interview on the computer. Asked general phlebotomist questions and why I was interested in the position. Overall, it was a great interview and relaxed.
Interview Questions: What is the order of draw?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Meet with the nurse manager at the unit. Usually bring in staff to peer interview after the nurse manager is done with questions. They will leave you with time at the end to ask them questions as well.
Interview Questions:
How do you work under pressure?
How you manage difficult interactions with patients and families?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at United Health Services (Binghamton, NY)
Interview Descriptions: This process was a Multi step interview lasting most of the day. There was a brief shadow of current provider. Requested printed resume not available to most electronically. Many interviewers asked  duplicated questions.  At the end of interview it was clear the level of interest by the manager.
Interview Questions: Where you see yourself in 5 years as well as managing difficult situations

title: Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Health Services (Murrieta, CA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers were very warm and welcoming and I did not feel at all like I was "put on the spot" with the cliché interview questions. They were brief but personable, to-the-point yet very friendly and I definitely felt like they were all team players, even the "higher-up" who was present. Made me feel like I would be a valued employee.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next few years?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Health Services
Interview Descriptions: This interview was very laid back but comfortable. HR was very welcoming and seemed genuinely interested in my experiences and what I would bring to their company, despite only being a nursing assistant.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a PA?

title: Associate Messaging Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Health Services
Interview Descriptions: I was asked basic questions about starting salary, and told what the job would include and that I should brush up on powershell and microsoft exchange. Also told to ask with any additional questions and that I would be contacted with further details
Interview Questions: Q: What kind of starting salary are you thinking?

title: Med Recep Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Smooth process, interviewed twice -one manager and one peer interview. I learned a lot, those that interviewed took interest in what I was saying and my experience. Overall, positive and pleasant experience. Questions in interview were legitimate and I felt comfortable sitting with the team.
Interview Questions: Went in to great detail about shift, hours, etc

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at United Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Phone call with recruiter, then brought in for in -person interview with several managers and HR representatives. Took a few days to get an offer. The process was very easy and smooth sailing. Good communication
Interview Questions: What I do in my free time

title: Collection Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Health Services in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Easy going and easy feeling. Comfortable. They speak with you like you're already part of the company. They help you learn. Know and grow. Great staff and terrific leads. I would recommend this company to anyone
Interview Questions: They asked about you and your mind

title: Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Health Services (Granger, IN) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: There are 2-3 interviews. The first is either a phone interview or an in person if convenient. The next one is with the program director and the executive director. Depending on if you are bilingual, you might also have a portion in Spanish with bilingual staff.
Interview Questions: How does your previous work transfer over and are you comfortable speaking and meeting with people of different cultural and socioeconomic backgrounds?

title: Customer Advocate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Great interview, was new experience for me. I applied on application and then had a video interview asking 3 simple questions. I tried to let my personality shine through
Interview Questions: How you went above and beyond for customers

title: Procurement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at United Health Services (King of Prussia, PA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: it was a Job fair, held Red Robin style.  Met with 2 groups of interviewers, Felt pretty good at the first table the second table the one person made me feel very uncomfortable.
Interview Questions: how I would handle a difficult situtation.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at United Health Services
Interview Descriptions: They were late and wouldn’t return calls.  I couldn’t get a straight answer on how long the process would take.  The CEO I spoke with kept moving blame to another CEO.
Interview Questions: Why did I stay at my last job?

title: Full Stack Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Health Services (New York, NY) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: first interview was by phone with a recruiter.. she was easy to talk to and relatively clear although there was some phone feedback, perhaps a recording. It lasted about 35 minutes
Interview Questions: Why did you choose our company to apply to?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at United Health Services
Interview Descriptions:
The first part of the process was one on one interviews 
The second  part of the process was an interview with the team
Overall it was a good interview experience
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at United Health Services (Binghamton, NY)
Interview Descriptions: They call you to set up an interview at the hospital. You then interview with the nursing manager of the floor. You may or may not go through a peer interview where fellow co workers interview you.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at United Health Services (Johnson City, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: 2:1 with managers, then a peer interview with other nurses who already work there.  Two interviews took place over two separate days about two to three weeks apart due to scheduling.
Interview Questions: Scenario Questions

title: Instructional Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at United Health Services (Doylestown, PA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Application is submitted online and then you will be contacted if the company is interested in meeting with you based on your qualifications. The interview process is simple and similar to other jobs.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation with a child that is non-compliant?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at United Health Services
Interview Descriptions: quick and easy interview process. i submitted an applicaton online, received an opportunity to meet with the floor manager and found out within a few days if i got the job.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for UHS

title: Performance Improvement Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at United Health Services (Binghamton, NY) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was on site and with a panel of 4 people from the PI team including the director of the team. 
It started with a few behavioral questions about knowledge about Healthcare and about the company. 
Further, different interviewers questioned about certain things from the resume which were relevant to the position and the field. 
Ended really quick with total time of 20 mins.
Interview Questions: Why do you want for UHS?

title: Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at United Health Services (Johnson City, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy process overall.  Long spans of time went by with limited communication.  It seemed challenging to navigate the HR/Employment Dept and the original job posted was eliminated before we even got started.  I was shocked to eventually receive an offer due to the delay.  Patience pays off in the long run!  Sadly, none of it moves quickly.
Interview Questions: Customer Service related questions.  Positive attitude, problem solving a must!

title: HIM Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Health Services (Binghamton, NY) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: A quick interview with a new manager and new assistant manager, honest in the interview about expectations, repeated questions about how do/can I handle stress and repetition of work/tasks.  The manager barely looked at me or even in the eye.  The assistant barely spoke was kind of just there.
Interview Questions: Can you explain a stressful work experience and what you did to handle that stress?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Health Services (Binghamton, NY) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview first, then a face to face interview. The face to face interview was with two of my peers and then one on one with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: In your current role how have you contributed to the success of the organization

title: Intake Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at United Health Services (Cypress, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: interview was very thorough, very pleasant, met 1 on 1, hiring manager was really nice, and caring, Offered water and snack. showed me around the building. Stayed on top of me getting hired, didnt beat around the bush.
Interview Questions: what can you contribute to the team?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at United Health Services (Binghamton, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had an intellectual conversation and QA session with VP and department Manager. Got valuable feedback after interview. Tested for integrity, skills, level of fit for the position and desire to learn.
Interview Questions: Description of previous projects

title: Clinical Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at United Health Services
Interview Descriptions: I participated in a phone interview with the DON who would be my immediate supervisor and then was scheduled for a peer interview including other supervisors, nurse managers, and staff.
Interview Questions: What is the biggest strength you would bring to this position?

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at United Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Initially interviewed with supervisor, 2nd round with peer interviewers.
Interview Questions: What are the reasons for the gaps in between employment.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at United Health Services (Johnson City, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview (I lived out of the area at the time) followed by in-person interview with the hiring manager. From application date to hiring date, entire process took over two months. Interview was pretty typical, asking mostly about my experience in the field. Overall process seemed to take longer than necessary.
Interview Questions: Could you tell me more about yourself?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at United Health Services (Shelton, CT) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: There were Four people present, manager, asst manager, social worker and direct manager, it took about an hour with each person asking some questions.  Each person presented questions that represented their areas of expertise.  The department manager presented personality questions.
Interview Questions: How did I get along as a team member

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at United Health Services (Binghamton, NY) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions: filled application with HR, called for interview, 1:1 interview, call back within 7 days
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you
